intro: Lasianthus kilimandscharicus subsp. hirsutus, commonly known as the hairy lasianthus, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of East Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its hairy foliage and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or grassland habitats, often at elevations above 2,000 meters. Its leaves are opposite and ovate, with a distinctive pubescent surface. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and restricted distribution.
